title: Rainbowz Mind Studio marketing website frontend (React + Tailwind)

requirements.summary: Build the 7-page marketing site with client-side routing, responsive layouts, and consistent navigation.
acceptanceCriteria: All 7 pages exist and are navigable via client-side routing.
Each page renders the sections described in the approved wireframes (hero, grids/cards, diagrams/visual metaphors, testimonials/proof where specified, and CTAs).
Navigation includes links to all primary pages and works on mobile and desktop.
All pages are responsive and visually consistent.

file_operations.description: Create the top-level app with client-side routing and route-to-page wiring for: Home, About, Our Method, Programs, Results & Outcomes, Parents’ Guide, Contact / Book Demo. Ensure pages are wrapped in the shared site layout and include scroll-to-top behavior on navigation.
Implement the Home page layout (hero + value props + proof/testimonials where specified + CTA blocks) using shared layout primitives and bento-style cards; include the hero visual overlay asset.
Implement the About page with wireframe-specified sections (mission/positioning, approach, credibility/proof as applicable, CTAs) using shared components.
Create the Our Method page shell and section scaffolding; detailed visuals and specialized blocks are handled under REQ-4.
Create the Programs page shell with the age-group selector and detail sections; interactive selector + FAQ specifics are handled under REQ-5.
Implement the Results & Outcomes page with outcomes cards, measurable-looking but non-medical proof framing, and a clear CTA to book a demo.
Implement the Parents’ Guide page with practical guidance sections, short scannable lists, and CTAs; keep copy concise and English-only.
Create the Contact / Book Demo page shell; form validation and success state are handled under REQ-6.
Add a single source of truth for primary navigation items (labels + routes) so Navbar and Footer can render links consistently without duplication.

requirements.summary: Create shared layout primitives and reusable UI building blocks (Navbar, Footer, sections, typography, buttons, cards, grids, CTA blocks).
acceptanceCriteria: Shared components are used across pages (no duplicated markup for the same patterns).
Primary and secondary buttons have consistent styling and hover/focus states.
Spacing rhythm is consistent across sections and pages.

file_operations.description: Create a shared layout wrapper that renders the Navbar and Footer and provides consistent page structure (background, max width, section spacing).

Create a responsive Navbar that renders all primary links from shared nav config, includes a mobile menu pattern, and highlights the active route. Use the shadcn-ui component library for accessible menu/dialog primitives if available; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create a Footer with repeated primary links, contact placeholders, and a final CTA; keep styling consistent with Navbar and global theme.
Create a Container primitive to standardize max-width and horizontal padding across all pages and sections.
Create a Section primitive to enforce consistent vertical rhythm, background variants (plain/tinted), and optional section headers.
Create typography building blocks for headings/subheadings/body text that map to Tailwind tokens and enforce consistent sizing and letter-spacing.

Create a Button wrapper that standardizes primary/secondary variants and focus/hover states. If composing shadcn-ui Button, do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create Card variants (bento/outline/soft) for consistent marketing sections. If composing shadcn-ui Card, do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create a reusable CTA block (headline + short copy + primary/secondary actions) used across pages to avoid duplicated markup.
Create a reusable grid preset for feature/value-prop cards (supports icons, titles, 1–2 lines of text) to standardize bento-style sections.
Create a reusable testimonials/proof strip component to be placed on pages where proof is specified in the wireframes.

requirements.summary: Apply the site-wide Tailwind design system per the provided style guide (calm scientific aesthetic, typography, spacing, English copy).
acceptanceCriteria: Global styling matches the specified palette and typography (Inter-like sans-serif, strong headings, readable body).
Section spacing follows the defined vertical rhythm (roughly 80–100px between major sections on desktop, appropriately reduced on mobile).
All user-facing copy is in English and matches the provided short-form copy where supplied (e.g., Home hero headline and CTAs).

file_operations.description: Create global Tailwind base styles: set CSS variables for the palette, apply global typography defaults (Inter-like sans-serif stack), define consistent section spacing helpers, and establish background/foreground defaults aligned to the calm scientific theme.

Extend Tailwind theme tokens to reflect the style guide (fontFamily sans, refined radii/shadows, optional custom spacing tokens for major sections) while keeping the existing CSS-variable color system intact.
Ensure document-level metadata supports the marketing site (language already set to en, update/confirm title if needed) and keep the site English-only.
Centralize short-form English copy (headlines, subheads, CTA labels, concise blurbs) so pages reuse consistent wording and tone across the site.

requirements.summary: Implement the Our Method page with required diagrams, cards, staircase, network graphic, and comparison table (non-proprietary).
acceptanceCriteria: The page includes all required sections in the stated order (or an equally clear logical order).
Techniques are presented as categories without revealing proprietary step-by-step activities.
The comparison section is a clear 2-column layout with 4 comparison points maximum.
Visuals favor diagrams/abstract graphics over cartoon brains or heavy academic visuals.

file_operations.description: Implement full Our Method page structure: (1) system overview diagram section (Technique → Brain Skill → Better Learning) using the generated diagram asset, (2) four brain-skill cards (Focus, Working Memory, Processing Speed, Creativity) using shared Card + thin-line icons, (3) technique category blocks (high-level categories only), (4) age-wise development staircase section using the generated staircase asset, (5) simple science network dots/lines section using the generated network asset, and (6) a 2-column comparison table (Traditional vs Rainbowz) with max 4 comparison points. Keep visuals abstract and calm; avoid proprietary step-by-step details.
Create a reusable 2-column comparison table block with a hard cap of 4 rows and a clear, readable layout for desktop and mobile.
Create a reusable diagram panel block (title + short explanation + responsive image + caption/alt text) to standardize how abstract graphics are presented on the Our Method page.

requirements.summary: Implement Programs page with age-group selector, per-group details, per-group CTA, and a concise FAQ strip.
acceptanceCriteria: Users can easily scan/select each age group and view its details.
Each age group section includes the required sub-blocks and CTA.
FAQ strip displays 4–5 concise questions in an easy-to-scan UI (e.g., accordions or compact list).

file_operations.description: Implement the age-group selector (5–7, 8–10, 11–14) with clear active state and responsive layout. For each group, render: what this age needs (1 line), skills trained, weekly structure, and a 'Book Demo for This Age' CTA that navigates to Contact / Book Demo with the age preselected (via querystring or location state). Add a concise FAQ strip at the bottom.
Add structured content for the three age groups (needs line, skills list, weekly structure bullets, CTA label) and 4–5 FAQ items to keep the page component clean and consistent.
Create a reusable selector control for age groups with accessible button semantics and keyboard focus styling.

Create a compact FAQ strip component. Prefer composing shadcn-ui Accordion for accessibility and motion; do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Implement Contact / Book Demo page with validated form, success state, map-like visual block, and alternate contact options (placeholders).
acceptanceCriteria: Form inputs exist for all required fields and perform basic client-side validation (required fields, simple phone format check).
Submitting the form provides a clear on-screen success state (e.g., confirmation panel) without requiring external services.
Alternate contact options are visible and styled consistently with the rest of the site.

file_operations.description: Implement the form (parent name, child age, phone, preferred time) with basic client-side validation and inline error messaging. On submit, show an on-screen confirmation panel (no external integrations). Render a 'map-like' visual block as a styled panel (non-functional) and display alternate contact options (call + WhatsApp) as consistent UI elements (non-functional placeholders). Support preselected age passed from Programs page.
Create a reusable Book Demo form component with controlled inputs, simple phone validation, and a success-state view that can be embedded on the Contact / Book Demo page.
Create UI blocks for alternate contact options (Call, WhatsApp) as styled cards/buttons (placeholders only) consistent with site theme.

requirements.summary: Apply a consistent calm scientific visual theme across all pages (whitespace, bento cards, geometric accents, thin-line icons, minimal diagrams).
acceptanceCriteria: All pages share the same visual language (cards, typography scale, icon style, section spacing).
Diagrams/visual metaphors appear as simple abstract graphics (lines, dots, arrows, rounded rectangles), not heavy illustrations.
No page introduces a conflicting color system, icon style, or spacing system.

file_operations.description: Create a small reusable geometric accent component (subtle lines/dots/rounded shapes) to be used consistently in hero and section headers without heavy illustration.
Ensure Home applies the shared theme: bento-style card grid, thin-line icon usage, consistent section spacing via Section/Container, and abstract accents (no conflicting colors/icons).
Ensure About applies the same theme tokens (typography scale, cards, spacing, icon style) and uses shared blocks for repeated patterns.
Ensure Results & Outcomes applies the same theme tokens and uses shared blocks (FeatureGrid/TestimonialStrip/CtaBlock) to prevent visual drift.
Ensure Parents’ Guide applies the same theme tokens and uses shared primitives for sections and typography for consistent rhythm.

requirements.summary: Add required generated static visual assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and render them in the appropriate sections with responsive sizing and alt text.
acceptanceCriteria: All generated images are stored in frontend/public/assets/generated and are referenced directly by the frontend (no backend image routing).
Hero and Our Method sections display the generated visuals with proper responsive sizing and alt text.
No external image hotlinks are required for the core layout to look complete.

file_operations.description: Add the generated asset file for the abstract geometric hero overlay (local static asset).
Add the generated thin-line icon sprite asset (local static asset) for consistent iconography.
Add the generated Technique→Brain Skill→Better Learning diagram asset (local static asset).
Add the generated age-wise development staircase diagram asset (local static asset).
Add the generated minimal neural network dots/lines graphic asset (local static asset).
Create a small helper component for rendering local generated images with consistent responsive behavior and required alt text.
Render frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-overlay.dim_1600x900.png in the hero section (as a decorative overlay) with appropriate alt handling and responsive sizing.

Render the Our Method visuals using local assets: frontend/public/assets/generated/method-flow-diagram.dim_1400x400.png, frontend/public/assets/generated/age-staircase.dim_1200x600.png, and frontend/public/assets/generated/science-network.dim_1200x600.png with responsive sizing and clear alt text. Use frontend/public/assets/generated/thinline-icons-sprite.dim_1024x1024.png (via a small icon component) for the four brain-skill cards.

Create an icon component that displays icons from frontend/public/assets/generated/thinline-icons-sprite.dim_1024x1024.png in a consistent thin-line style across pages. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
